item.title: Big potholes along Coldharbour Lane, 16th February
item.description:
Coldharbour Lane between Cambria Road and Atlantic Road is riddled with potholes, which are increasing in number and depth, many are 3 inches deep. About 15 new potholes have appeared in the past 2 months. There is one particularly dangerous area at the northeast corner of Coldharbour Lane and Hinton Road where a drain cover in the carriageway has seen all the paving around the cover erode, so effectively there's a 3-inch deep, 5-inch wide "moat" around the drain cover. This is really dangerous to cyclists because it forces us to swerve into the line of oncoming traffic, as the carriageway at this location is narrow with not enough room to avoid the drain cover while staying out of the way of traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296, Coldharbour Lane, Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole length of Baring Road, is pitted and is full of large deep puncture prone pot holes, 16th February
item.description:
For more years than I can remember the whole length of this road has been rapidly deteriorating with numerous pot holes, road collapses, and tarmac degrading Now its in such a bad state. Several of the holes now have got so bad, they are often full of water or have had a traffic cone placed in them, with traffic having to weave around them and gravel and large lumps of road scattered over the carriageway The worst section being between Kingsand Road and Grove Park Esso Garage, this stretch really in need a full resurface There is one particular hole at the Junction with Coopers Lane by the traffic island where large vehicles, Buses, struggle to squeeze between the massive hole and the traffic island.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 244A, Baring Road, Chinbrook, Grove Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large holes in verges, 16th February
item.description:
The remedial works undertaken following the gas main works in Lincoln Road last year have failed. In the verges throughout the road there are deep holes where vehicles have driven along the verges. These present a trip hazard, especially in the dark. These photos show the holes outside 13, 20 and 24 Lincoln Road but there are holes present all through the road. I am aware that the road is being resurfaced shortly. Given the safety aspects of these holes. Perhaps they could be remedied at the same time?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lincoln Road, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several Deep Pot holes and road surface deterioration, 16th February
item.description:
Located heading in south alson the A208 Mottingham Road, by the speed camera and the traffic island by Ravesnworth School. 2 deep pot holes which are hard to avoid because of the traffic island. There is also surface deterioration next to 3 iron work covers in the road. Also going the other direction, also next to the traffic island, anther 3 holes are starting to get deeper, again being next to the island, they are hard to avoid
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mottingham Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water from rain standing for days, 16th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Park, Hackney, London
